Inference: Water usage dropping sharply during rain detections indicates effective rain-based irrigation suppression
Description: When rain is detected and water usage per cycle decreases immediately, the system is successfully conserving water during rainfall.
short rationale: Shows prompt rain-based shutoff; operational efficiency with low privacy risk.

Inference: Water usage remaining high during rain detections suggests irrigation override or misconfiguration
Description: If the system continues watering despite rain, rainfall suppression logic may be disabled or malfunctioning.
short rationale: Reveals override/misconfig behavior despite rain; operational exposure.

Inference: Water usage dropping only slightly during rain detections indicates conservative or minimal rain-based adjustments
Description: The system may reduce irrigation modestly, assuming rainfall only partially meets watering needs.
short rationale: Partial adjustment behavior; mild operational signal.

Inference: Water usage dropping to zero during rain detections indicates complete reliance on rainfall
Description: The system fully shuts off irrigation when rainfall occurs, maximizing water conservation.
short rationale: Full shutoff during rain; operational logic with limited privacy impact.

Inference: Rain detections followed by delayed water usage reduction suggest buffering logic or verification thresholds
Description: Irrigation may stop only after rainfall persists long enough to satisfy system criteria.
short rationale: Delay exposes threshold/buffering settings; mild operational detail.

Inference: Water usage increasing during long gaps between rain detections indicates dry periods requiring more irrigation
Description: The absence of rainfall forces the system to compensate with higher irrigation volumes.
short rationale: Dry-gap compensation; operational trend only.

Inference: Water usage remaining low even during long gaps between rain detections suggests environmental moisture retention or low plant demand
Description: Despite the lack of rain, irrigation needs stay low due to soil conditions or weather factors.
short rationale: Low demand despite no rain; site condition signal, low privacy risk.

Inference: Water usage spikes immediately after rain detection gaps indicate recovery watering
Description: Following rainfall-free periods, the system increases irrigation to replenish soil moisture.
short rationale: Post-gap replenishment behavior; operational pattern.

Inference: Frequent rain detections paired with consistently low water usage indicate rain-dominant climate periods
Description: Natural rainfall regularly replaces irrigation needs, keeping water usage minimal.
short rationale: Rain replaces irrigation; climate-driven low demand.

Inference: Frequent rain detections paired with high water usage indicate insufficient rainfall intensity
Description: The rain sensor detects rain often, but rainfall is too weak to reduce irrigation demand.
short rationale: Rain too weak to offset irrigation; operational threshold clue.

Inference: Water usage plateauing at low levels during sustained rain detection clusters indicates extended wet-season behavior
Description: Continuous rain keeps water usage consistently low across cycles.
short rationale: Wet-season low demand; operational/climate context.

Inference: Water usage plateauing at high levels despite frequent rain detections suggests malfunctioning rain sensor or ignored rainfall
Description: The system does not respond appropriately to detected rainfall, causing unnecessary irrigation.
short rationale: High use despite rain reveals malfunction/ignored sensor; operational exposure.

Inference: Rapid water usage drops following strong rain detection clusters indicate high rainfall effectiveness
Description: Intense rainfall reduces irrigation demand immediately and significantly.
short rationale: Strong rain quickly reduces irrigation; operational response only.

Inference: Gradual water usage decline across multiple rain detections indicates cumulative soil saturation
Description: Each rainfall event increases soil moisture enough to reduce irrigation needs progressively.
short rationale: Cumulative rain lowers irrigation; operational trend.

Inference: Water usage stability despite numerous rain detections suggests soil hydrophobicity or canopy interception
Description: Rainfall may not reach the soil effectively, requiring continued irrigation.
short rationale: Hydrophobic/canopy effect; site condition with limited privacy impact.

Inference: Water usage variability increasing during mixed rain detection periods suggests inconsistent rainfall intensity
Description: Fluctuating rain strength results in alternating irrigation adjustments.
short rationale: Usage variability tracks inconsistent rain; operational context.

Inference: Water usage spikes occurring only when rain detections stop indicate rapid environmental drying
Description: After rain ends, evaporation may increase quickly, requiring more irrigation.
short rationale: Post-rain drying triggers higher use; operational behavior.

Inference: Water usage spikes that occur during isolated rain detections indicate possible false rain signals
Description: If water usage increases despite rain being detected, rain detection may be erroneous.
short rationale: Spikes during rain suggest false detection/maintenance issue; operational exposure.

Inference: Water usage decreases occurring before rain detections suggest forecast-based irrigation reduction
Description: The system reduces watering in anticipation of upcoming rainfall.
short rationale: Pre-rain reductions expose anticipatory control/scheduling behavior.

Inference: Water usage increases occurring before long rain-free intervals indicate predictive dry-weather compensation
Description: The system boosts irrigation ahead of expected dry conditions.
short rationale: Pre-emptive increases reveal forecast/behavioral planning.

Inference: Lack of water usage reduction during long rain detection streaks indicates threshold-based logic requiring higher rainfall intensity
Description: The system may only reduce irrigation when rainfall exceeds a certain threshold.
short rationale: Non-reduction despite rain discloses threshold/logic settings.

Inference: Significant water usage reduction during minor rain detections suggests overly sensitive rainfall thresholds
Description: Even light rain leads to noticeable irrigation suppression.
short rationale: Oversensitive thresholds revealed; operational configuration exposure.

Inference: Water usage profiles mirroring rain detection timing indicate strong integration between rainfall events and irrigation
Description: Usage drops and rises closely follow rain patterns, showing tight coupling.
short rationale: Tight coupling to rain timing; mild operational exposure.

Inference: Water usage profiles diverging from rain detection timing indicate additional irrigation drivers
Description: Soil moisture, schedules, or manual controls may override rain-based decisions.
short rationale: Divergence reveals other controls/overrides; operational behavior exposure.

Inference: Water usage dropping across all zones during rain detections suggests uniform rainfall distribution
Description: Rainfall affects the entire irrigation area equally, reducing watering everywhere.
short rationale: Uniform zone response; low-risk site context.

Inference: Water usage dropping only in certain zones during rain detections indicates localized rainfall
Description: Some areas receive rain while others remain dry, requiring zone-specific irrigation.
short rationale: Zone-specific rain effect; minor site profiling.

Inference: Water usage increasing across all zones after multi-day periods with no rain detections indicates system-wide compensation for drought conditions
Description: The entire property requires more irrigation due to prolonged dryness.
short rationale: System-wide compensation; operational trend.

Inference: Water usage decreasing across all zones after strong rainfall periods indicates widespread soil saturation
Description: Rainfall saturates soil uniformly, reducing watering needs everywhere.
short rationale: Uniform saturation reduces use; operational/climate context.

Inference: Water usage failing to change during rain detection events suggests irrigation logic operates independently of rainfall
Description: The system may rely solely on schedules or soil moisture and ignore rain detection signals.
short rationale: Independence from rain reveals control design/override; operational exposure.

Inference: Water usage declining slowly during periodic rain detections indicates intermittent rainfall insufficient for rapid soil hydration
Description: The system gradually reduces irrigation as rainfall accumulates over time.
short rationale: Slow decline with intermittent rain; operational trend only.

Inference: Water usage increasing sharply after rain detections cease indicates rehydration need following shallow or ineffective rainfall
Description: Rainfall did not penetrate deeply enough, requiring supplementary irrigation.
short rationale: Rehydration after light rain; operational pattern.

Inference: Water usage stabilizing at a moderate level during alternating rain/no-rain detections indicates balanced irrigation adjustment
Description: The system modulates irrigation to accommodate inconsistent rainfall patterns.
short rationale: Balanced adjustment; low privacy risk.

Inference: Water usage trending upward despite frequent rain detections indicates strong evapotranspiration pressure
Description: Environmental drying forces overcome rainfall contributions, requiring more irrigation.
short rationale: Strong environmental demand forcing higher use; operational context.

Inference: Rain detections occurring only during low water usage cycles indicate system responsiveness to scheduled irrigation windows
Description: Rain impacts the system most when irrigation is scheduled during rainfall events.
short rationale: Shows rain impact tied to schedule windows; exposes timing behavior.

Inference: Rain detections occurring during high water usage cycles indicate overlapping rainfall and irrigation activity
Description: Rainfall and irrigation may coincide unintentionally, suggesting scheduling improvements.
short rationale: Overlap reveals scheduling gaps/behavior; operational exposure.
